sections.purpose: To evaluate anxiety-related behavior in rodents.
sections.scope: Applicable to psychopharmacology and anxiolytic drug screening.
procedure: Place the animal at the center of the maze facing an open arm.
Start the timer and observe behavior for a fixed period (e.g., 5 minutes).
Record time spent and entries into open and closed arms.
Remove the animal and return it to its home cage.
Clean the maze with 70% alcohol between animals.
Analyze data to calculate anxiety indices.
precautions: Test animals in a quiet, low-light room.
Avoid repeated testing of the same animal unless protocol allows.
Handle animals gently before and after testing.
Ensure maze is stable and at safe height.
Do not use animals with motor impairments.
